merge

Description

Creates one multichannel array out of several single-channel ones.

Signature

cv2.merge(mv[, dst]) â†’ dst

Parameters

  • mv (array of np.ndarrays): List of single channels to be merged
  • dst (optional; np.ndarray): Output array of the same size and the same depth as mv[0]; The number of channels will be the total number of channels in the matrix array.

Explanation

This function merges separate single-channel arrays into a multi-channel array: \(\text{dst}(I)_c = \text{mv}[c](I)\). This is most commonly used to merge separate image planes for B, G, and R channels into a color image.

Notes

  • The function split() does the reverse operation. If you need to shuffle channels in some other advanced way, use mixChannels().

References

  • OpenCV Documentation
Created with OpenCV 4.4.0
